Gravity is a force that pulls objects downwards. When an object is placed down, gravity causes it to move towards the Earth until it encounters a supporting surface or object.
Fabrics are flexible materials. When a flexible object is placed on a surface under gravity, it will drape and conform to the shape of the supporting surface and any objects on that surface.
